messages: f94f854949fc94f06c85986f1e814b34 (13:03): is JSONP really insecure for private data?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:03): http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/bbcinternet/2011/02/frame_accurate_video_in_html5.html

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:04): "as of this week, after 120 emails, the bleeding edge development versions of several HTML5 implementations (as used in Safari, Chrome, Mozilla and many others) are now fully frame accurate"
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (13:26): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: awesome!
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:29): it's great to see an article like that giving credit to the actual developers who did the work
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (13:29): hell yeah
a5d17df58428f1d15bc813872fbb470e (13:29): developers are pretty cool these days
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (13:39): f94f854949fc94f06c85986f1e814b34: If any site you visit can access the data, would you call it private?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (13:43): opera devs, please support CORS
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:49): the comments about Workers in http://dt.deviantart.com/blog/38471599/ are particularly interesting
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:55): hmm, my schedule for today was not very ambitious
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:55): I wonder if I missed something
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:58): that blog post from the BBC is a nice change from the one some time ago
f94f854949fc94f06c85986f1e814b34 (14:00): i wish flash sockets + html5 websockets cover 100% of browsers
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:02): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, maybe you can reply to John's email about the draft with information on pubrules?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:02): or I can do it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:02): that is, giving a link to http://www.w3.org/Guide/pubrules
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:11): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: if you can, that'd be great
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:11): I looked for him on #chromium but not finding him
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:12): the source really should be updated to use the JS respec
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:12): but I'm not sure it's worth stopping to take time to do that now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:12): though it actually wouldn't take too much time
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:13): I don't know whether he's got the source set up that way because he actually prefers that, instead of editing HTML and using JS, or what
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:14): I know nothing about Respec
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:14): but I'll bring it up
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:16): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, do I need to email out some pubrequests?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:16): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, guess we need shortname approval
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:16): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:16): actually
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:16): need to mail the chairs list
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:18): "The Chair sends a transition request to the Domain Lead(s) responsible for the group(s) publishing the document, cc'ing <email/> and <email/>"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:19): "The goal of the transition request is to secure an archived record of the Domain Lead(s)' approval of the title, and shortname."
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:20): I will give PLH a heads-up about this today
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:20): it's a holiday in the US I guess
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:20): he'll probably be on for a bit anyway
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:24): okay, I can do that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:25): first ever email to chairs I think
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:25): back to Member-only territory brrr

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:28): i guess I shouldn't say that

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:41): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, included request for being able to copy a public list going forward

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:44): I just read it, it's fine as-is
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:44): I suspect plh answer will be, you are free to copy to www-archive if you want
